(55) 823rd April, 1955CABINETELECTION BUSINESS committee note by the Secretary of the CabinetOn a Dissolution it is customary for the Government to appoint, for the periodof the Election campaign, a Cabinet Committee to supervise the work of advisingGovernment candidates about the replies which they should return toquestionnaires and other enquiries put to them during the campaign. The PrimeMinister has accordingly appointed a Committee to carry out these duties,consisting of: Lord Chancellor (in the Chair).Commonwealth Secretary.Minister of Housing and Local Government.Minister of Health.Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation.Chief Whip.Financial Secretary, Treasury.2. The Secretaries of the Committee will be Mr. R. M. J. Harris andMr. F. A. Bishop, Cabinet Office.(Signed)NORMAN BROOK.\Cabinet Office, S.W. 1,22nd April, 1955.47953
